pullRequest.title: Skip intro and ending per feed
pullRequest.bodyText:
fix #1552
I'm ready for a code review.
On a per feed basis

Allow the user to set skip intro and skip ending dialog in preferences
When the usrs plays an episode, show them a toast message that we are skipping ahead and marking ending early
When we are ending early, give them a toast message as well

Feedback needed:

Are there too many toast messages?
I added 2 more fields into the database.  What do I need to do to make sure there isn't any issues for people to import and export databases when they upgrade?  Take a look at the debug log https://gist.github.com/tonytamsf/e704090f5031e58da240ea976da8d1f5
2.1) looks like this upgrade code worked

#3975

nodes.bodyText: Building Strings like this can break in other languages. I think an additional string Skipped %1$d seconds of intro would be better.
Why do you display both numbers? I think we should not display more information than necessary.

Please move this to DBUpgrader. Also, use oldVersion < 1090001. Users might skip AntennaPod versions. When checking for equality, this skips the migration when coming from, say 1080100 instead of exactly 1090000.
Please only increment by 1.

Not sure if LocalPSMP is the right place to do this. What about Chromecast (RemotePSMP) or other media players that might get added in the future? I think this fits better into PlaybackService (but I am not sure where exactly).

The UI should not be responsible for doing playback actions. If the user closes the UI, episodes should still get skipped. When adding the skipping code like this and swiping out the player during playback, this is no longer the case.
Additionally, this introduces code duplication. This should be done centrally, somewhere in the PlaybackService.
Is there a case where the title might be different from R.string.pref_feed_skip? I do not think this needs to be a parameter.

This file could need some code cleanup. There are some duplicated namespace declarations, indentation is not consistent and the number of empty lines between Views is not consistent. Ctrl+Alt+Shift+L in Android Studio could help.

commit.message: move upgrade to the right right place, increment version by 1 only
no need for dialog title to be diff

nodes.bodyText: Is this method used anywhere? I'd vote to just add code that we actually need.
Please use the same indentation as the rest of the file
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,6 +21,11 @@
             android:title="@string/playback_speed"
             android:summary="@string/pref_feed_playback_speed_sum"/>
 
+    <Preference
+        android:key="skipping"
+        android:summary="@string/pref_feed_skip_sum"
+        android:title="@string/pref_feed_skip" />

nodes.bodyText: GLOBAL in the case of SPEED_USE_GLOBAL means that the feed uses the speed that is set globally (for all feeds). Skipping is not a setting that is available globally (and I don't think it should be). So please rename to something like DEFAULT or just remove the variables (used in one place only).
Please add a space before the plus here :)

             + KEY_LAST_UPDATE_FAILED + " INTEGER DEFAULT 0,"

-            + KEY_FEED_VOLUME_ADAPTION + " INTEGER DEFAULT 0)";
+            + KEY_FEED_VOLUME_ADAPTION + " INTEGER DEFAULT 0,"
+            + KEY_FEED_SKIP_INTRO + " INTEGER DEFAULT 0,"
+            + KEY_FEED_SKIP_ENDING+ " INTEGER DEFAULT 0)";

nodes.bodyText:
There is a checkstyle file in config/checkstyle/ that I want to enforce for new code. Because the existing code is quite inconsistent, CI only checks a small fraction of things. In the past months, I did the checks manually and commented on GitHub. In #3978, I enabled checking the diff on CI.
I think checkstyle will complain about this line. Have not checked the rest of the code. Just that you already know before I merge #3978 and it suddenly complains.
This is no longer needed, I think.
I think you can directly add the format parameters to getString. Then Android Studio can do better analysis.
Just wondering: Does this honor the "Follow queue" setting?
Please use the androidx alert dialog. It has the same interface but it might have better compatibility with old Android versions.
Please add an empty line between the methods. Not sure why checkstyle did not complain about that. The checkstyle config file needs some more changes, I think.
Doesn't this mean that the intro is not skipped if you play it for the second time?
I would move this up into the two ifs above. Then you can skip the check (skipIntroMesg != "" if and only if the code above is executed).
I would use Skipped instead of Skip in the Toasts because they show something that happened, not an action that can be done.

@@ -449,6 +449,12 @@
     <string name="pref_playback_speed_title">Playback Speeds</string>
     <string name="pref_playback_speed_sum">Customize the speeds available for variable speed audio playback</string>
     <string name="pref_feed_playback_speed_sum">The speed to use when starting audio playback for episodes in this podcast</string>
+    <string name="pref_feed_skip">Auto Skip</string>
+    <string name="pref_feed_skip_sum">Skip introductions and ending credits.</string>
+    <string name="pref_feed_skip_ending">Skip last</string>
+    <string name="pref_feed_skip_intro">Skip first</string>
+    <string name="pref_feed_skip_ending_toast">Skip last %d %s</string>

nodes.bodyText: I don't think that this is enough. If AntennaPod automatically plays the next item in the queue, this code is not executed.

commit.message: skipIntroPref and skipEndingPref at the right places

nodes.bodyText: Why is this method called skipIntroPref? Why pref?

I think it would be easier for the translators if you just added the text "Seconds" to "Skipped first" in strings.xml. I do not think that we want to skip other units than seconds. Additionally, this gives a weird mix of languages if "Seconds" is translated but "Skipped first" is not translated.
This is always true. You check for FeedMedia in the line above.

commit.message: skip right before our ending, so we can replay

nodes.bodyText: I think this could be done inside FeedPreferenceSkipDialog to keep the FeedSettingsFragment a bit shorter

commit.message: move str to in logic to the right place
consider auto skipping the exact same behavior has an episode ending
listen to events when the Feed preference changed for skipIntro and skipEnding

nodes.bodyText: What about skipEndingIfNecessary?
Please remove this. It is executed every second, so this floods the log output

This PR does not include the more strict diff-checkstyle CI rule. The && characters should be in the next line. Also, indentation should be 8 spaces when breaking the same statement.
You can select the file config/checkstyle/checkstyle-new-code.xml in IntelliJ/Android Studio (with checkstyle version 8.18 and "Treat errors as warnings") to get inline suggestions. Alternatively, you can rebase the commit with a more recent develop branch to have it executed on CI.
Could you please make above statements a single line each? There is a lot of horizontal screen space left :)
Hmm this adds quite a lot of code for a single use-case. What about checking the position here instead of adding the Playable methods?
Missing space :)
Only one statement per line, please
Can this be private? I think it would be enough to only save the ID instead of the whole object.
Sorry, I just noticed this line (otherwise, I would have written that earlier). Please use a constant here, just like the other preferences in this class.
